speaker: BENEDICK
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: BENEDICK
text_entry: SCENE I. Venice. A street.

speaker: BENEDICK
text_entry: Enter RODERIGO and IAGO

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Tush! never tell me; I take it much unkindly

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: That thou, Iago, who hast had my purse

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: As if the strings were thine, shouldst know of this.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Sblood, but you will not hear me:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If ever I did dream of such a matter, Abhor me.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Thou told'st me thou didst hold him in thy hate.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Despise me, if I do not. Three great ones of the city,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In personal suit to make me his lieutenant,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Off-capp'd to him: and, by the faith of man,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I know my price, I am worth no worse a place:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But he; as loving his own pride and purposes,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Evades them, with a bombast circumstance

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Horribly stuff'd with epithets of war;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, in conclusion,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nonsuits my mediators; for, 'Certes,' says he,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'I have already chose my officer.'

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And what was he?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Forsooth, a great arithmetician,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: One Michael Cassio, a Florentine,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A fellow almost damn'd in a fair wife;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That never set a squadron in the field,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nor the division of a battle knows

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: More than a spinster; unless the bookish theoric,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Wherein the toged consuls can propose

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As masterly as he: mere prattle, without practise,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is all his soldiership. But he, sir, had the election:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And I, of whom his eyes had seen the proof

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: At Rhodes, at Cyprus and on other grounds

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Christian and heathen, must be be-lee'd and calm'd

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: By debitor and creditor: this counter-caster,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He, in good time, must his lieutenant be,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And I--God bless the mark!--his Moorship's ancient.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: By heaven, I rather would have been his hangman.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, there's no remedy; 'tis the curse of service,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Preferment goes by letter and affection,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And not by old gradation, where each second

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Stood heir to the first. Now, sir, be judge yourself,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Whether I in any just term am affined

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To love the Moor.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I would not follow him then.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, sir, content you;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I follow him to serve my turn upon him:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: We cannot all be masters, nor all masters

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cannot be truly follow'd. You shall mark

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Many a duteous and knee-crooking knave,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That, doting on his own obsequious bondage,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Wears out his time, much like his master's ass,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For nought but provender, and when he's old, cashier'd:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Whip me such honest knaves. Others there are

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who, trimm'd in forms and visages of duty,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Keep yet their hearts attending on themselves,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, throwing but shows of service on their lords,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do well thrive by them and when they have lined

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: their coats

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do themselves homage: these fellows have some soul;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And such a one do I profess myself. For, sir,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It is as sure as you are Roderigo,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Were I the Moor, I would not be Iago:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In following him, I follow but myself;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Heaven is my judge, not I for love and duty,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But seeming so, for my peculiar end:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For when my outward action doth demonstrate

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The native act and figure of my heart

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In compliment extern, 'tis not long after

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But I will wear my heart upon my sleeve

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For daws to peck at: I am not what I am.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: What a full fortune does the thicklips owe

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: If he can carry't thus!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Call up her father,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Rouse him: make after him, poison his delight,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Proclaim him in the streets; incense her kinsmen,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, though he in a fertile climate dwell,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Plague him with flies: though that his joy be joy,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet throw such changes of vexation on't,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As it may lose some colour.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Here is her father's house; I'll call aloud.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do, with like timorous accent and dire yell

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As when, by night and negligence, the fire

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is spied in populous cities.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: What, ho, Brabantio! Signior Brabantio, ho!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Awake! what, ho, Brabantio! thieves! thieves! thieves!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Look to your house, your daughter and your bags!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Thieves! thieves!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: BRABANTIO appears above, at a window

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: What is the reason of this terrible summons?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: What is the matter there?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Signior, is all your family within?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Are your doors lock'd?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Why, wherefore ask you this?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Zounds, sir, you're robb'd; for shame, put on

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: your gown;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Your heart is burst, you have lost half your soul;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Even now, now, very now, an old black ram

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is topping your white ewe. Arise, arise;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Awake the snorting citizens with the bell,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or else the devil will make a grandsire of you:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Arise, I say.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: What, have you lost your wits?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Most reverend signior, do you know my voice?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Not I what are you?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: My name is Roderigo.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: The worser welcome:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I have charged thee not to haunt about my doors:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: In honest plainness thou hast heard me say

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: My daughter is not for thee; and now, in madness,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Being full of supper and distempering draughts,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Upon malicious bravery, dost thou come

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: To start my quiet.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Sir, sir, sir,--

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: But thou must needs be sure

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: My spirit and my place have in them power

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: To make this bitter to thee.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Patience, good sir.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: What tell'st thou me of robbing? this is Venice;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: My house is not a grange.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Most grave Brabantio,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: In simple and pure soul I come to you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Zounds, sir, you are one of those that will not

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: serve God, if the devil bid you. Because we come to

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: do you service and you think we are ruffians, you'll

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: have your daughter covered with a Barbary horse;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: you'll have your nephews neigh to you; you'll have

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: coursers for cousins and gennets for germans.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: What profane wretch art thou?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am one, sir, that comes to tell you your daughter

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: and the Moor are now making the beast with two backs.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Thou art a villain.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You are--a senator.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: This thou shalt answer; I know thee, Roderigo.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Sir, I will answer any thing. But, I beseech you,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: If't be your pleasure and most wise consent,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: As partly I find it is, that your fair daughter,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: At this odd-even and dull watch o' the night,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Transported, with no worse nor better guard

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: But with a knave of common hire, a gondolier,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: To the gross clasps of a lascivious Moor--

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: If this be known to you and your allowance,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: We then have done you bold and saucy wrongs;

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: But if you know not this, my manners tell me

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: We have your wrong rebuke. Do not believe

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: That, from the sense of all civility,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I thus would play and trifle with your reverence:

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Your daughter, if you have not given her leave,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I say again, hath made a gross revolt;

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Tying her duty, beauty, wit and fortunes

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: In an extravagant and wheeling stranger

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Of here and every where. Straight satisfy yourself:

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: If she be in her chamber or your house,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Let loose on me the justice of the state

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: For thus deluding you.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Strike on the tinder, ho!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Give me a taper! call up all my people!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: This accident is not unlike my dream:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Belief of it oppresses me already.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Light, I say! light!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Exit above

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Farewell; for I must leave you:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It seems not meet, nor wholesome to my place,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To be produced--as, if I stay, I shall--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Against the Moor: for, I do know, the state,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: However this may gall him with some cheque,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cannot with safety cast him, for he's embark'd

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With such loud reason to the Cyprus wars,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Which even now stand in act, that, for their souls,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Another of his fathom they have none,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To lead their business: in which regard,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though I do hate him as I do hell-pains.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet, for necessity of present life,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I must show out a flag and sign of love,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Which is indeed but sign. That you shall surely find him,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lead to the Sagittary the raised search;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And there will I be with him. So, farewell.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter, below, BRABANTIO, and Servants with torches

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: It is too true an evil: gone she is;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: And what's to come of my despised time

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Is nought but bitterness. Now, Roderigo,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Where didst thou see her? O unhappy girl!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: With the Moor, say'st thou? Who would be a father!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: How didst thou know 'twas she? O she deceives me

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Past thought! What said she to you? Get more tapers:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Raise all my kindred. Are they married, think you?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Truly, I think they are.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: O heaven! How got she out? O treason of the blood!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Fathers, from hence trust not your daughters' minds

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: By what you see them act. Is there not charms

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: By which the property of youth and maidhood

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: May be abused? Have you not read, Roderigo,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Of some such thing?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Yes, sir, I have indeed.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Call up my brother. O, would you had had her!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Some one way, some another. Do you know

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Where we may apprehend her and the Moor?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I think I can discover him, if you please,

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: To get good guard and go along with me.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Pray you, lead on. At every house I'll call;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I may command at most. Get weapons, ho!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: And raise some special officers of night.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: On, good Roderigo: I'll deserve your pains.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Exeunt
